places.name: Saigon Centre

reviews.text:
Located in the heart of District 1, Saigon Centre stands out as one of Ho Chi Minh City's most upscale and well-curated shopping destinations. Modern, spacious, and beautifully designed, this mall effortlessly combines international luxury with local elegance.

The crown jewel of Saigon Centre is Takashimaya, the prestigious Japanese department store that serves as the mall's key attraction. Spanning multiple floors, Takashimaya offers a premium shopping experience with a wide selection of high-end fashion brands, cosmetics, accessories, and gourmet food items. It's particularly known for its refined ambience and impeccable customer service, making it a favorite among both locals and tourists.

Beyond Takashimaya, Saigon Centre hosts a mix of global brands like Zara, Calvin Klein, H&M, Charles & Keith, and Adidas, making it the go-to spot for branded goods in the city. The mall is also home to some of the best international and Asian dining outlets, offering everything from Japanese sushi and Korean BBQ to artisanal coffee and local Vietnamese delights.

The ambience is clean and chic, with ample natural light, wide walking spaces, and elegant decor. Whether you're here for luxury shopping, casual browsing, a meal, or simply to escape the heat, Saigon Centre offers a premium yet welcoming environment.

Rating: 4.7/5 ‚Äì A must-visit mall for anyone looking to enjoy the best of shopping, food, and leisure in HCMC.

All the Shopping you need !

Saigon Centre is a premier shopping and business complex located in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City, offering a modern and upscale environment that appeals to both locals and visitors.

For photographers, the centre presents a dynamic blend of sleek contemporary architecture, glass facades, and bustling urban energy. Inside, the multi-level mall features stylish boutiques, trendy cafes, and open spaces filled with natural light, ideal for capturing lifestyle and architectural shots.

The rooftop garden and observation areas provide panoramic views of the city skyline, perfect for golden hour and night photography. Whether focusing on vibrant street scenes outside or the polished interior ambiance, Saigon Centre is a versatile location that reflects the rapid growth and cosmopolitan spirit of Saigon.

Saigon Centre in HCM is a sleek, modern shopping mall with a mix of interesting stores and big-name brands. Prices for most things are close to Western levels.

It's well worth a wander if you're after quality shopping or just need a break from the heat, thanks to its excellent air conditioning. There's a great optician on the basement floor for quick, professional service if you need a new pair of glasses.

Crescent Mall, located in District 7 of Ho Chi Minh City, is one of the city's premier shopping destinations, known for its sleek, modern design and wide array of retail, dining, and entertainment options. Nestled along the scenic Crescent Lake, the mall offers a refreshing atmosphere, providing a relaxing shopping experience in a spacious, well-designed environment.

The mall houses a mix of international and local fashion brands, electronics stores, and home decor outlets, making it a one-stop shop for a variety of needs. From high-end luxury boutiques to more affordable mainstream stores, Crescent Mall caters to a broad demographic, ensuring there's something for everyone.

Dining at Crescent Mall is another highlight, with a wide range of restaurants and cafes offering diverse cuisines. Whether you're looking for fast food, casual dining, or something more upscale, there are plenty of options to satisfy any craving. The mall also features a large supermarket, CGV cinema, and an entertainment area for kids, making it a popular destination for families.

Crescent Mall's picturesque location next to the lake allows for leisurely strolls along the promenade after a day of shopping. The area is well-maintained and designed for a comfortable, upscale shopping and dining experience, making it a favored spot for locals and expats alike in Saigon.

reviews.text:
Vincom Mega Mall Th·∫£o ƒêi·ªÅn is an excellent destination for shopping, dining, and entertainment! The mall offers a wide variety of stores, ranging from local brands to international retailers, making it a one-stop shop for everything you need.

The food court is impressive, with numerous options to suit all tastes, whether you're craving Vietnamese cuisine, Western dishes, or quick snacks. I also loved the spacious layout, modern design, and how clean the entire place is.

The cinema and play areas make it a great spot for families, while the supermarket downstairs is convenient for grocery shopping. Parking is well-organized, and the mall is easily accessible by public transport.

Highly recommended for anyone visiting or living in Th·∫£o ƒêi·ªÅn!

Came back here after two years and was really impressed by the variety and number of well-known brands and restaurant chains, especially Japanese ones- like Uniqlo, Nitori, Matsumoto Kiyoshi, Muji, and GiGo. They even have a go-kart area now, which is pretty cool!

However, as mentioned by some other reviews, one thing I couldn't overlook was the overall ambiance, specifically the ‚ú®BACKGROUND MUSIC‚ú®. It was a bit too loud, and the playlist didn't quite match the vibeüíÄ. If the music were more thoughtfully curated, something like what you'd hear at Crescent Mall- it would make the place feel even more welcoming, especially for international visitorsüòâ iykyk.

There's a petting zoo on the 4th floor. There's alpacas, chickens of all sizes and other animals. The alpacas and the baby chicks are in bad shape,  the alpacas seem to have an infection and the baby chicks are losing hair. The pens of the animals stink and they don't look like they've been cleaned for a few days.

Feeding the birds was pretty cool and the I door slide for my kid was great.

reviews.text: I recently visited Gigamall Shopping Center in Thu Duc City, Ho Chi Minh City, and was really impressed by its modern design and diverse offerings. What sets Gigamall apart is its combination of shopping and entertainment ‚Äì there's a cinema, an indoor playground, a VR Game Zone, and many dining options with both Vietnamese and international cuisines. Overall, Gigamall is a great place to shop, eat, and relax with friends or family. I would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting the area.

reviews.text: Diamond Plaza is a stylish, upscale mall tucked in the stylish core of District 1, right across from the iconic Notre Dame Cathedral. The elegant blend of colonial architecture and modern glass design gives it a distinctive Saigon charm. Inside, four floors feature luxury cosmetics, fashion, accessories, gadgets, and home goods. Floor four offers an array of Vietnamese and Asian eateries, plus entertainment like bowling and cinema. You'll appreciate the thoughtful amenities - kids' play zones, baby care rooms, clinic, and VIP seating - all wrapped in a calm, well-maintained setting despite being in the city's busiest area. It's a polished, convenient spot to shop, dine, or unwind - and definitely photo-worthy.

Hung Vuong Plaza is a notable shopping and entertainment complex in Ho Chi Minh City, located in District 5. It features four floors dedicated to shopping, offering a wide range of products from over 300 brands, including fashion, cosmetics, and sportswear‚Äã . The Parkson department store within the plaza is particularly popular for its variety and affordability‚Äã.

For dining, Hung Vuong Plaza has two food courts situated on the 4th and 6th floors, where you can find both local and international food options such as KFC, Lotteria, and Hoang Yen Cuisine‚Äã ‚Äã. Entertainment options include a CGV Cinema on the 7th floor and a large game zone on the 4th floor, making it a great place for both shopping and leisure‚Äã‚Äã.

Overall, Hung Vuong Plaza provides a comprehensive shopping experience with added entertainment and dining facilities, catering to a diverse range of interests and preferences.

reviews.text: Set underneath Landmark 81. Taxis at the front and back. B1 plenty of food and a central food court. I ate in several of these places. The ramen place is excellent. DIMai and Coco Ichibanya are also excellent. Large Vinmart on B1 too. There are 3 floors of shops, some are high end. I bought eye glasses here too. Ownways, excellent. I like this mall, there are less people. Not like Vincom mall in Dist1 or Takashimaya, which are packed. 5*

Great shopping experience! The mall is clean, open, and full of options for food as well. You can also buy tickets to see the top of Landmark 81 here - the views were incredible! In terms of restaurants/experiences, I recommend Nagocha for a matcha tasting and trying out the Laotian restaurant for some of the most amazing food ever.

We arrived at around 4PM and there were a few visitors already. The 360deg view of the city is fantastic and we took a lot of photos. The lady operating the VR was so impatient to the point of being rude..she should be considerate especially to first time users. Despite of that, It's a very nice experience overall!

reviews.text: Nice place to sit down. Have a coffee and watch the world go by.

Good food and friendly service, but also extremely slow and the dishes came one by one, sometimes with 15-20 minutes in between. In the end we had to leave before the last dish came - that was over an hour after ordering. Beware the staff soeak basically no english so you just have to point on the menu, which is fine as there are pictures. Otherwise it was a nice atmosphere and nice view. We sat on the top floor.

Very chill place. Good for people watching. There is nothing much to do or see except to just get a drink and watch the people go by.
There are those live performers and people selling balloons and cotton candy opposite.
But I wouldn't call this a place to come or do anything. It's just a place of interest whereby you come here and people watch. Nothing much to buy either.

Saigon Square ‚Äì Ho Chi Minh City

A favorite among both locals and tourists, Saigon Square is one of HCMC's top spots for affordable fashion and accessories. Located in District 1, it offers a huge variety of clothes, shoes, bags, and more-often at bargain prices. While many items are branded, most are either factory surplus or imitations, so bargaining is key.

With air-conditioned comfort, a central location, and fast-paced market vibes, it's a great place to shop if you're hunting for deals. Just remember to check product quality and carry cash. Ideal for budget-conscious shoppers looking for trendy styles without the luxury price tag.

Quick Tip: Visit early to avoid crowds and get the best selections!

From traditional Vietnamese dishes like Quang Noodles to international favorites like Dimsum and Sticky rice, there's something for every palate at affordable prices. places.name: Menas Mall Saigon Airport

reviews.text: The Yum Food Village food court is a great place to eat! It has a beautiful view, spacious and comfortable seating, and a wide variety of dishes to choose from. The prices are reasonable, making it a perfect spot for both quick bites and relaxed meals. Highly recommended for anyone looking for good food in a nice setting.

Upon entering the centre looks a little abandoned with empty stores and popup market style discount clothing and cosmetic stores. After making it up to the 5th floor, I found some pretty good food stores. I read the reviews from a few months ago and they note it is new and stores are still to open but seems to be the same (01/2025).

Menas Mall truly exceeded my expectations. The space is not only modern and beautifully designed, but also incredibly spacious and comfortable. It's the perfect spot for shopping, dining, or just relaxing with friends. An ideal destination for anyone looking for a pleasant and enjoyable experience.

reviews.text: Central market is a huge underground basement market consists of many stalls selling all types of goods and a food center, It is air-conditioned and the stalls sellers are not pushy at all. You can take your own sweet time to browse comfortably, unlike banh ‚Ä¶ market.

Central Market in Ho Chi Minh is sometimes mistaken for the big outdoor Ben Thanh Market .. OK .. I made this mistake .. but it's a totally different vibe. Tucked mostly underground, it's got air-con, a calmer pace, some decent shops, and even a billiard club hidden inside. Worth a look if you want a break from the street chaos and maybe a sneaky game of pool.

A nice little market with a wide array of shops selling mostly clothes, but also souvenirs. The quality of the items on sale seemed to be pretty good, with prices fairly reasonable. The market also has a gym and billards club. The food hall had a really impressive offering of restaurants. If I had been hungry at the time I visited, I would have found it difficult to choose!
